column4: so I'm trying to install ubuntu 6.10 on an IBM T23, and it keeps freezing during the install
is there a way to do text mode install? I can't see one.
is this a known problem with live cd?
it doesn't freeze, but the install stops responding after a few screens.
should do, propably another hardware problem, tried switching VCs on hangup?
use aptitude/synaptic and query to find out
a nice installer (for on the commandline), you will need to install it first (sudo apt-get install aptitude)
https causes encryption to happen. encryption costs CPU cycles. CPUs that are more utilized run hotter. Running hotter burns electricity. Therefore using https costs money.
the way I know this is, I like a quiet system. So I have a fan with a manual speed control and keep it turned down. I also have a temperature monitor.
